summary: **Rent** is a rock musical by Jonathan Larson, inspired by the opera *La boh√®me*. It follows young artists struggling to live and create in New York's East Village while dealing with HIV/AIDS. First performed in 1996, it moved to Broadway and won big awards, including the Pulitzer Prize. The show ran for 12 years and was a huge success, leading to tours and a movie. Larson sadly passed away the night before the off-Broadway premiere.
title: Rent (musical)
